subject: Photography
title: War Photography
description: A short lesson to help you apply War Photography.

hook.text: Robert Capa said: 'If your pictures aren't good enough, you're not close enough.' He died proving it.

buildup.text: War photographers brought the reality of combat into living rooms â€” raw, bloody, undeniable.

discovery.text: Capa's D-Day photos and Nick Ut's 'Napalm Girl' changed public opinion about wars thousands of miles away.

twist.text: Governments learned to fear the camera. Censorship followed, then embedded journalism, then controlled access.

climax.text: War photography proved that showing the truth can be more powerful than any weapon.

punchline.text: The camera didn't stop wars. It made them harder to ignore.

quiz.question: How did war photography change public attitudes?
